content: Are the COVID test codes likely to be added soon? I've got an IG spitting warnings about the test codes not being valid
There is an import bug that so far has prevented loading LOINC 2.69. :(
We'll try to get it resolved as soon as possible.
@Rob Hausam any update on this? We need to use the COVID lab test codes from LOINC for the Vaccination Credential IG.
They can't make the latest version of LOINC load. They've been fighting with it for months
If the value set references codes that don't "exist" validation will fail

@Max Masnick @David Pyke Yes, David is correct. I think I can probably work around this for now by massaging the LOINC source data, and I need to find a few minutes (or hours, maybe) to try that out. If we can get that done then we can deal with getting the importer code fixed later (at least by the time of the next release). I haven't tried that approach yet, but it seems likely doable and I'll see if I can make headway with it hopefully later today.

Rob Hausam said:

If we can get that done then we can deal with getting the importer code fixed later (at least by the time of the next release). I haven't tried that approach yet, but it seems likely doable and I'll see if I can make headway with it hopefully later today.

Who owns the importer code? And is this something that MITRE could theoretically help fix?

@Max Masnick It's Grahame's code (originally), but of course anyone should be welcome to contribute. The pascal stream is where it's discussed and you can see what's involved. I haven't added a topic for this particular LOINC import issue yet, but we could.
Ah, Pascal may make it hard to find someone who can work on it.
I can now report that I've finally worked through fixing the issues that we had with the LOINC loader, and LOINC has now been updated to 2.69 on tx.fhir.org! @Max Masnick @David Pyke

Rob Hausam said:

I can now report that I've finally worked through fixing the issues that we had with the LOINC loader, and LOINC has now been updated to 2.69 on tx.fhir.org! Max Masnick David Pyke

Thank you!!!
